content.text:
# Draft:List of discontinued antivirus software

The following is a list of antivirus programs and security suites that have been discontinued or are no longer actively maintained.
* Windows Live OneCare: Subscription-based antivirus and PC maintenance service developed by Microsoft, discontinued in 2009.
* Microsoft Security Essentials: Free antivirus program for Windows 7 and earlier, replaced by Windows Defender in later versions.
* CA Anti-Virus: Antivirus software developed by Computer Associates (CA Technologies), later discontinued as part of its consumer product line.
* PC Tools: Security software company acquired by Symantec; its products like PC Tools AntiVirus were discontinued in 2013.
* Norton AntiVirus Plus (2001): Early standalone version of Norton AntiVirus, later merged into Norton Security and Norton 360 suites.
*Norman ASA: Norwegian security company known for Norman Virus Control, acquired by AVG Technologies in 2014 and discontinued.
*Lavasoft: Developer of Ad-Aware antivirus; the original company and product line were discontinued and rebranded.
*VirusScan: Early antivirus product line by McAfee, later replaced by McAfee LiveSafe and McAfee Total Protection.
*Central Point Anti-Virus: DOS-based antivirus developed by Central Point Software, discontinued after Symantec's acquisition in 1994.
*IBM AntiVirus: Early enterprise antivirus developed by IBM, discontinued after the late 1990s.
*ThunderBYTE Anti-Virus: Hardware-based antivirus solution popular in the early 1990s, discontinued in 1998 after Norman acquired the technology.
See also
* List of Windows antivirus software
* List of macOS antivirus software
* List of Android antivirus software
* Comparison of antivirus software
